description: Retrieves information about the specified listener rules. You can also retrieve information about the default listener rule. For more information, see Listener rules in the Amazon VPC Lattice User Guide.

parameters.name: listenerIdentifier
parameters.description: The ID or ARN of the listener.

parameters.name: ruleIdentifier
parameters.description: The ID or ARN of the listener rule.

parameters.name: serviceIdentifier
parameters.description: The ID or ARN of the service.

nested_items.name: fixedResponse
nested_items.description: The fixed response action. The rule returns a custom HTTP response.

nested_items.name: statusCode
nested_items.description: The HTTP response code.

nested_items.name: targetGroups
nested_items.description: The target groups. Traffic matching the rule is forwarded to the specified target groups. With forward actions, you can assign a weight that controls the prioritization and selection of each target group. This means that requests are distributed to individual target groups based on their weights. For example, if two target groups have the same weight, each target group receives half of the traffic.

nested_items.name: targetGroupIdentifier
nested_items.description: The ID or ARN of the target group.

nested_items.name: weight
nested_items.description: Only required if you specify multiple target groups for a forward action. The weight determines how requests are distributed to the target group. For example, if you specify two target groups, each with a weight of 10, each target group receives half the requests. If you specify two target groups, one with a weight of 10 and the other with a weight of 20, the target group with a weight of 20 receives twice as many requests as the other target group. If there's only one target group specified, then the default value is 100.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the listener.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The date and time that the listener rule was created, in ISO-8601 format.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The ID of the listener.

nested_items.name: isDefault
nested_items.description: Indicates whether this is the default rule.

nested_items.name: lastUpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The date and time that the listener rule was last updated, in ISO-8601 format.

nested_items.name: httpMatch
nested_items.description: The HTTP criteria that a rule must match.

nested_items.name: headerMatches
nested_items.description: The header matches. Matches incoming requests with rule based on request header value before applying rule action.

nested_items.name: caseSensitive
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the match is case sensitive.

nested_items.name: contains
nested_items.description: A contains type match.

nested_items.name: exact
nested_items.description: An exact type match.

nested_items.name: prefix
nested_items.description: A prefix type match. Matches the value with the prefix.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the header.

nested_items.name: method
nested_items.description: The HTTP method type.

nested_items.name: pathMatch
nested_items.description: The path match.

nested_items.name: caseSensitive
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the match is case sensitive.

nested_items.name: exact
nested_items.description: An exact match of the path.

nested_items.name: prefix
nested_items.description: A prefix match of the path.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the listener.

nested_items.name: priority
nested_items.description: The priority level for the specified rule.
